text.tspan: In both modes, the diffraction grating diffracts the light
beam into its component wavelengths, which are then
analyzed by the detector and data analysis system to
determine the properties of the sample.
The main difference is in how the light beam interacts with
the sample, in reflection mode the light is reflected from
the surface of the sample and in transmission
mode the light beam is sent through the sample.
X-ray source: produces a beam of X-rays that are
Detector: measures the intensity and angle of the
Goniometer: rotates the sample and detector to
Collimator lens: limits the size of the X-ray beam
to only pass through the sample
